meanings.definition: Consisting of dialogue in which two characters speak alternate lines.
meanings.sent1: The play had a stichomythic scene where the characters spoke in turns.
meanings.sent2: The stichomythic exchange between the actors made the audience follow closely.
meanings.sent3: In the stichomythic conversation, they sounded like a duet of words.
meanings.sent4: The stichomythic dialogue resembled a verbal game of tennis.
meanings.sent5: The stichomythic style of speaking created a rhythmic pattern on stage.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a style of dramatic dialogue in which each line is a single metrical unit.
meanings.sent1: The stichomythic play had a poetic flow to it.
meanings.sent2: The actors delivered their lines in a stichomythic manner, emphasizing each word.
meanings.sent3: The stichomythic rhythm of the lines added a musical quality to the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had a stichomythic quality, like a lyrical dance of words.
meanings.sent5: The stichomythic structure of the dialogue made it sound like a poetic chant.
